summary: This is an internal email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-SDNY) discussing the need to file a letter to the court in the case of United States v. Tartaglione. The letter will inform the court that due to errors in the Metropolitan Correctional Center's (MCC) computer system, video footage from outside the cell shared by Nicholas Tartaglione and Jeffrey Epstein on the night of Epstein's suicide attempt was not preserved, correcting earlier statements to the contrary. The document anticipates significant press attention.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York; the email is copied to him and he is listed as the district point of contact in the synopsis.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: A defendant awaiting trial for kidnapping and quadruple murder, who was sharing a cell with Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC when Epstein attempted suicide. His defense seeks video to support his claim that he alerted guards.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The financier and sex offender who was found dead in his MCC cell. The document discusses the night of his attempted suicide on July 23, 2019, while he was sharing a cell with Tartaglione.

connections.description: They shared a cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on July 23, 2019, the night Epstein attempted suicide.
Berman's office, the USAO-SDNY, is prosecuting Tartaglione and authorized to seek the death penalty against him.

events.title: Epstein's Suicide Attempt in MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein attempted suicide in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, which he shared with Nicholas Tartaglione.

events.title: USAO-SDNY Receives Incorrect Video
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office obtained a copy of the requested video from the MCC and found it did not show the tier outside Tartaglione and Epstein's cell.

events.title: MCC Informs of Video Preservation Error
events.description: The MCC informed the Government that an error in its computer systems led to the preservation of video from the wrong tier, and the correct video was lost due to a system failure.

keyFacts: The MCC failed to preserve video from outside the cell shared by Nicholas Tartaglione and Jeffrey Epstein on July 23, 2019, due to a computer system error.
The USAO-SDNY had previously informed the court the video was preserved, based on conversations with MCC, and must now correct that statement.
The correct video is permanently lost because the MCC's video system suffered a failure approximately six days after Epstein's suicide attempt.
Tartaglione's defense seeks the video to corroborate his claim that he alerted guards to Epstein's suicide attempt, a fact the prosecution does not intend to dispute.
The document anticipates the court filing about the lost video will generate significant negative press attention.
